intro: Paullinia parvibractea, commonly known as the small-bracted poinsettia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble the leaves of the poinsettia. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically yellow or green, and are surrounded by the showy bracts.
